result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andre J Patterson

records.addlTxt: State's Witness List; received and filed.
State's Motion in Limine; received and filed.

Defendant entered a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. 
Expires December 28, 2022.

Defense requested Final PreTrial and Jury Trial dates. Court ordered parties to submit their Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions, and Witness Lists by the Final PreTrial date. Any Motions are due by the Final PreTrial date. If the parties believe a necessary witness for the State or Defense requires independent representation, they are to make arrangements for that representation through the Public Defender's Office two (2) weeks in advance of the Final PreTrial. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and SPEEDY Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

Final PreTrial scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.
SPEEDY Jury Trial scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Andre J Patterson in Court, in custody.  Attorney Gregg H. Novack in Court for Andre J Patterson.  Attorney William T. Berens appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case re-called. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial. State filed original Information. Defense counsel waived reading of Information, and entered a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of Defendant. State to provide Defense counsel with discovery material and an offer via digital system. Scheduling Conference proceeded. 

FILED: Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver.

Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense; signed and filed. 
Attorney Gregg Novack

Defendant Andre J Patterson in court with Attorney Thomas Holland Reed on behalf of the Public Defender's Office. Defendant Andre J Patterson is in custody.  Attorney William T. Berens appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status of Counsel hearing or Order to Show Cause hearing. Discussion placed on the record. State Public Defender's Office failed to timely appoint counsel for the Defendant. Statements by Defendant. For reasons stated on the record, Court found Defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel at COUNTY EXPENSE. Court appointed Attorney Gregg H. Novack to represent Defendant in this matter at County Expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. Court ordered the Defendant is NOT REQUIRED to reimburse Milwaukee County; however, Court ordered the Defendant to pay a one-time fee of $60.00 by the completion of the case. Case adjourned for Preliminary hearing, Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
OSPD APPOINTMENT OF COUNSEL REPORT, received, filed and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant Andre J Patterson in Court with Attorney Thomas Holland Reed on behalf of the Public Defender's Office. Defendant Andre J Patterson in custody.  Attorney William T. Berens in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for an Order to Show Cause hearing. Court reviewed OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report. Discussion placed on the record. Public Defender's Office has NOT been able to appoint counsel for Defendant. Court TOLLED TIME LIMITS. Court ordered case adjourned for Order to Show Cause hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Clerk provided information to the Public Defender's Office. If counsel has not been appointed by the next date, Court will appoint counsel. Order to Show Cause hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 10:00 am. Hearing will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
OSPD APPOINTMENT OF COUNSEL REPORT; received and filed.

Defendant Andre J Patterson not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting Attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status. SPD has not appointed counsel.  Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Andre J Patterson not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for status. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Status conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Andre J Patterson in court with Attorney John C Glover.  Defendant Andre J Patterson in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing at 1:30pm, case called at 8:30am. Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant. Case adjourned for CAUSE for status of counsel in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Status conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Correspondence dated June 28, 2022 from Attorney Glover; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Attorney John Glover in court, appear by video. Defendant Andre J Patterson not in court, in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Defendant refuse to come to court. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with James B.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Andre J Patterson in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Defendant Andre J Patterson in custody.  Sara Beth Hill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Andre J Patterson
Current: 3829 N. 25th St., Milwaukee, WI 53206   (Effective: 06-18-2022)
Prior: 2628 North 20th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
